translated: One should visualize the six-syllable mantra in one’s heart center, on top of a moon, like a garland of light rays, inside one’s house.

analyzed: sngags ni aom ma ni padme h'um zhes pa yi ge 'bum du bzlas so //
translated: The mantra is “Oṃ maṇi padme hūṃ.” One should recite the mantra one hundred thousand times.

analyzed: de nas gnyis pa dang gsum pas sdig pa dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, by the second and third [recitations], one’s sins will be purified.

analyzed: mtshams med pa lnga byed pas kyang bye ba bzlas pas dngos grub tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Even one who has committed the five acts of immediate retribution will attain power by reciting [the mantra] ten million times.

analyzed: de las ldang bar 'dod na mchod yon la sogs pa phul nas /

translated: In the four periods between sessions, one should recite [the mantra] and dedicate the roots of virtue to the attainment of one's desired goal.

analyzed: nam phyed nas ye shes sems dpa' gshegs su gsol la yi ge brgya pa brjod cing /

analyzed: lus dang / ngag dang / yid bsrung bar byas nas ci bder gnas par bya ste /

original: gal te nad la sogs pa zhi bar 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te nad la sogs pa zhi bar 'dod na /
translated: If one wishes to pacify illness and so forth,

translated: one should make a square maṇḍala in front of the venerable one with cow dung that has fallen from a place swept by the wind of a victorious star.

analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa la yi ge drug pa dang sbyar nas lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas par bya'o //
translated: One should recite the six-syllable [mantra] one hundred and eight times in conjunction with one's desired goal.

original: zla ba drug gis the tshom med par 'grub po zhes so //
analyzed: zla ba drug gis the tshom med par 'grub po zhes so //
translated: In six months, [the goal] will be accomplished without a doubt.

original: za ma tog bkod pa'i man ngag gis mdzad pa'i yi ge drug pa'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so /
analyzed: za ma tog bkod pa'i man ngag gis mdzad pa'i yi ge drug pa'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so /
translated: The sādhana of the six-syllable [mantra] composed by the instruction of the Array of the Basket is complete.
